intro: Quinqueremulus linearis, commonly known as the linear thistle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, spiny stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the spring and summer months. Quinqueremulus linearis is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
